data: {"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3559931,"name":"","username":"annvoor","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/8c91f0/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-18T00:06:27.991Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eI’m currently having an issue where for some reason, when we drive our motors are getting some sort of opposite voltage applied causing the robot to drive very jerkily and slowly. We managed to get around it by doubling our code max speed and tuning \u003cspan class=\"abbreviation\"\u003ePID\u003ctemplate class=\"tooltiptext\" data-text=\"Proportional Integral Derivative\"\u003e\u003c/template\u003e\u003c/span\u003e, but I still want to figure out the problem.\u003cbr\u003e\nOur team started running custom swerve last year with Falcons and this wasn’t a problem, but this year we switched to Krakens and it started happening. I can see on Advantagescope that our actual motor state vector is always less than the desired state, and the state snaps backward when we slow down causing the robot to jerk backward. I am, at this point, 100% sure that something is applying an opposite voltage to wherever we’re trying to move but I cannot figure out why.\u003cbr\u003e\nI’m thinking it’s maybe an electrical issue with Krakens as opposed to a programming one because this was never a problem with Falcons, but I’ve tried things like disabling brake mode and it does nothing. We’re using swervelib/\u003cspan class=\"abbreviation\"\u003eYAGSL\u003ctemplate class=\"tooltiptext\" data-text=\"Yet Another Generic Swerve Library\"\u003e\u003c/template\u003e\u003c/span\u003e. Has anybody ever encountered a similar problem/have any ideas?\u003c/p\u003e","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":4,"updated_at":"2025-03-18T19:09:09.401Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":17,"reads":107,"readers_count":106,"score":121.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":495979,"topic_slug":"backwards-voltage-on-custom-swerve-krakens","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":74430,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"4904 Programming Lead"},"post_url":"/t/backwards-voltage-on-custom-swerve-krakens/495979/1","custom_user_title":"4904 Programming Lead","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3560938,"name":"Tim Winters","username":"ArchdukeTim","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/archduketim/{size}/256125_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-18T19:11:48.318Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eNot a direct solution to your issue, but if you’re running all Krakens, are you also running cancoders and a pigeon?
